title: Adding new account
creator: wpjohns
content:
I am setting up a new computer with Linux Mint and Thunderbird. I got my primary comcast.net account added in and working but when trying to add another account I get the following:

Unable to connect

The connection was refused when attempting to contact localhost. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Thunderbird is permitted to access the web.

Since the first account works, I assume there is no problem with network connection, firewalls, or proxy settings. I have confirmed spellings of username and password. Any ideas?

creator: info13520
content:
Hello, since friday, 6.2. thunderbird does not launch new (and also not completely all older) Emails anymore. So I can't see all my recieved and send E-Mails. In all my 3 Mail-Accounts froms different providers it does not work anymore, without changing anything from my side I know. But from my handy, where I use google-Mail, it works.

I already checked synchronization settings and repaired the E-Mail-folders.

So, are there any technical defects or problems with thunderbird, an update for instance that caused trouble for instance? And what can I do, to make it work again? Atherwise I would have to quit thunderbird and change my Host.

Looking forward to your response and already thanks for support, all the best, M.

title: Sending email using TB via Yahoo slow and unreliable
creator: Leo.Levosky
content:
I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong but in the last 3-6 months sending email from TB using Yahoo SMTP server is very slow and fails completely one out of three times. If I keep trying it eventually works without me having to make any changes.

I've been using Yahoo for a very long time without any problems but changing to OAuth2 seems to have slowed things down.

I have a fast internet connection and nothing else is causing any issues.

title: Thunderbird 115.10.1 (32bit)
creator: citronik
content:
Dear Sir / Madam, I am still running a perfectly good Win 7 computer. My Mail Inbox & Sent Box have a huge number of Emails i have been trying to delete in batches. They initially go to my Deleted folder which shows the number of emails collected. I then empty the deleted folder. so far so good, except the huge file size in my inbox or sent box hasn’t changed! But the deleted folder is now showing empty! The emails i selected to delete seem to have disappeared, but i have not recovered any disk space! I am running out of disk space in C drive because i cannot seem to remove these emails. I have tried shutting down my computer & rebooting (i shut it down every night) this has no effect.

If i had a tool to open the sent / inbox file i could manually delete emails in old date order? Hope someone out there can help.

Kind regards Nick

title: ENCORE ET ENCORE blocage logiciel si mauvais m d passe d'un compte mail
creator: st.magnin
content: Bonjour à tous et toutes, Je ne dois pas être le seul à demander ou redemander, cette question auquelle je ne trouve pas une seule solution éventuellement proposée, qui règle le souci Explication J'ai donc thunderbird avec 5 comptes de mails d'opérateurs différents dont, l'emmerdeur FREE En effet, en plus du logiciel, j'ai un vpn sur mon pc et mon mobile pour le travail et autres Si par malheur j'interroge mon mail free avec mon vpn actif soit sur pc ou sur le mobile, tout se passe correctement mais trés rapidement dans la nuit cet emmerdeur de free bloque mon mail, annule le mot de passe car il a détecté le MAL !!! et bloque toutAlors les ennuis commencent avec thunderbird Je m'arrache les cheveux, car à peine déclencher evidemment il interroge free et là !! bim !!! refusé ! et c'est le caca !! la fenêtre de connexion pour free, n'arrête pas de revenir bloquant tout, tout !! tant qu'il n'aura pas un bon m d passe ! et je ne veux pas supprimer le compte mail pour débloquer, car cela fou la merde avec tous mes dossiers de mails free enregistrés dans thunderbird , et c'est pénible de tout remettre et relancer et reconfigurer comme on le souhaite Je voudrais savoir pour les ingénieurs et leurs grandes antennes de thunderbird, ne font rien pour ce souci a priori réccurent et connu On m'a dit de décocher des cases pour essayer de "sauter" free mais aucune solution ne fonctionne C'est une vraie plaie à l'appréciation de ce logiciel. Alors svp une vraie réponse de pro claire façon tuto et fonctionnelle svp pitié !!

title: Unable to Log in at Server - Posteo
creator: srnordgren
content:
Hello, I'm new to Thunderbird, trying to connect my accounts for the first time. I've tried linking my new Posteo email, and I'm getting the same error message that it looks like many people are getting for various accounts (especially gmail) -- "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." It's the correct username (email address) and password, and I'm selecting IMAP, which is the recommended configuration in Posteo's own instructions for linking with Thunderbird. I can't find any trouble shooting info that's not for gmail. (I haven't tried to link my gmail yet).

I would appreciate any help with this matter. I was excited to use Thunderbird, and now I'm wondering if I need to find a different option.

title: New account same email OR reconnecting Local folders after switching hosting providers
creator: jennifer22
content:
Hi. I recently had to change email providers and at first chose Proton but had to change again for reasons. Before I moved to proton, I shifted a whack of email to local folders on the advice of someone. I backed up my profile folder before making the move to proton, but didn't realise (I know, 'duh') that local folders didn't move. It wasn't untill I moved again that the local folders in the new install were empty.

All 3 accounts—original, proton & new—had the same email account name/domain but I want to know how I could create another instance of it to port all my old email from the original service—which has all the email still in their original folders (not local) so I have them 'non-local' again and can go through and organize them anew.

The alternative is to connect the local folders to this new instance but I'd rather the first scenario.

I'll only still have access to all 3 providers for another couple of weeks so this is feeling urgent.

Any help/suggestions most welcome. Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:win-11
